title: Sports Challenge
content:
IntroductionThis section of the application will give you some information on various sports, and then test your knowledge at the end with a quiz. Don't worry if you don't get it all at first, there is an opportunity at the end to retake the quiz.
FootballPopularityFootball is played in every country and is the most popular sport in the world. The game involves 11 players on each team with the aim being to get the ball into the opponents goal. Football in ScotlandScotland has its on football league that has two of the biggest teams in world in it, Celtic and Rangers. In the past it was a lot more competitve than it is now, with Celtic currently the dominant team. The national team isn't doing too well at the moment, with Scotland ranked 67th in the world, and no major trophies to their name.hampdenImage.jpgFor full list of the current world rankings https://www.fifa.com/fifa-world-ranking/ranking-table/men/,click hereTournamentsIn terms of club competitions the Champions league is the biggest there is. The top teams from each country compete in this tournament. It has produced some incredible moments, such as the famous Zidane goal scored in the 2002 Champions League final which is belowZidane GoalThere is also the World Cup, which the best countries in the world compete. Unlike clubs which have many nationalities, players for international teams are all from the same country.
Racquet SportsRacquet sports are games in which players use rackets to hit a ball or other object. Some of the more popular ones include badminton, tennis and squash.TennisTennis is a racquet sport that can be played individually against a single opponent (singles) or between two teams of two players each (doubles). Each player uses a tennis racket that is strung with cord to strike a hollow rubber ball covered with felt over or around a net and into the opponent's court. The object of the game is to play the ball in such a way that the opponent is not able to play a valid return. The player who is unable to return the ball will not gain a point, while the opposite player will.Andy MurrayCurrently the number one tennis player in the world is Scotland's Andy Murray. He has won 3 grand slams and got a knighthood from the Queen this year.andyMurray.jpgBadmintonBadminton is a racquet sport played using racquets to hit a shuttlecock across a net. Badminton is often played as a casual outdoor activity in a yard or on a beach; formal games are played on a rectangular indoor court. Points are scored by striking the shuttlecock with the racquet and landing it within the opposing side's half of the court.Shuttlecockshuttlecock.jpgAsian countires such as China and Japan have produced some of the best players at this sport.
Other sportsThere are thousands of sports in the world, some very different from otheres. Scotland has always excelled in sports, with the number one tennis player in the world, and a big sporting history here are some more sports that are big in Scotland.RugbyWhile Scotland have always been an okay team in rugby, recently they have been amazing, narrowly losing to Australia in the world cup, and wins against Wales and Ireleand in the six nations have put Scotland in the top 5 in the world (but not yet ranked number 1).rugby.jpgThe biggest stadium in Scotland is their rugby pitch, Murrayfield, which holds 67,000 people. Their supporters are renouned for being passionate and loud, with the stadium full for most of their matches.CyclingScotland have always had great success in the cylcing, paricularly in the Olympics. The indivual with the second most amount of Olympic gold medals is Sir Chris Hoy, who has 6 gold medals. chrisHoy.jpgFor the Commomwealth games in 2014 which was proudly hosted in Glasgow, as Velodrome, which is an indoor cycling track, was named after him in his honour.GolfGolf is a club and ball sport in which players use various clubs to hit balls into a series of holes on a course in as few strokes as possible.Home of golfThe sport of gold was created in Scoland, with the very first course being St Andrews. It is now played around the world, with interest around the world. At the moment there has not been many successful Scottish golfers, however it will always be known as a Scottish sport.stAndrews.jpg
QuizRight, you're ready to be quizzed on your knowledge of sport! Please click the button below to start the quiz!
